required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A First-in-human Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of MAS825 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A First-in-human, Randomized, Subject-blinded, Placebo-controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of MAS825 in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The study is conducted to investigate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of MAS825 in healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.description: To assess the safety and tolerability of single i.v./s.c. doses of MAS825

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of MAS825: Maximum Plasma Concentration [Cmax]
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum (peak) observed plasma, blood, serum, or other body fluid drug concentration after single dose administration (mass x volume-1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters of MAS825: Time to reach maximum concentration [Tmax]
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax is the time to reach maximum (peak) plasma, blood, serum, or other body fluid drug concentration after single dose administration (time)
The AUC from time zero to the last measurable concentration sampling time (tlast) (mass x time x volume-1)
The AUC from time zero to infinity (mass x time x volume-1)
The elimination half-life associated with the terminal slope (lambda_z) of a semi logarithmic concentration-time curve (time). Use qualifier for other half-lives
CL is the systemic (or total body) clearance from plasma (or serum or blood) following intravenous administration [volume / time]
Vz is the volume of distribution during the terminal elimination phase following intravenous administration [volume]
Vz/F is the apparent volume of distribution during the terminal elimination phase following s.c. administration (associated with λz) (volume)
Vss is the volume of distribution at steady state following intravenous administration [volume]
CL/F is the apparent systemic (or total body) clearance from plasma (or serum or blood) following s.c. administration [volume / time]

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Healthy male and female subjects 18 to 45 years of age included, and in good health as determined by past medical history, physical examination, vital signs, electrocardiogram, and laboratory tests at screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women of child-bearing potential, defined as all women physiologically capable of becoming pregnant
- A history of ongoing, chronic or recurrent infectious disease, or evidence of tuberculosis infection as defined by a positive QuantiFERON TB-Gold test
- Fasting LDL > 160 mg/dL, at screening.
- Subjects in cohorts D1 and D2 (Japanese cohorts) must be of first to third generation Japanese ethnic origin.

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com
